body_html:
Actually, this issue comes up after the upgrading of our system. It upgraded from Debian kernel 4.9.0-6-amd64 to 4.9.0-7-amd64, and cuda 8 to cuda 9.

Before the upgrading, we have

  • CUDA 8.0
  • Pytorch 0.3.0 post 4
  • Installed by pip install cu90/torch-0.3.0.post4-cp27-cp27mu-linux_x86_64.whl

Though we installed pytorch compiled with cuda 9.0, it worked with our cuda 8 environment, and there was no hangs.

body:
Actually, this issue comes up after the upgrading of our system. It upgraded from Debian kernel 4.9.0-6-amd64 to 4.9.0-7-amd64, and cuda 8 to cuda 9.

Before the upgrading, we have
- CUDA 8.0
- Pytorch 0.3.0 post 4
- Installed by pip install cu90/torch-0.3.0.post4-cp27-cp27mu-linux_x86_64.whl

Though we installed pytorch compiled with cuda 9.0, it worked with our cuda 8 environment, and there was no hangs.
